page.title: 09CUTTHORPE VILLAGE - 3
page.content: {Religious Services}are held on{ {alternate Sundays }in the {Institute. {There is a Methodist Chapel }with a Sunday School. Farming is carried on all round the village and there is a medium sized prize flock of {Suffolk {sheep, }and large milking herd of Freisian crossed{Hereford cows}at Hall Farm. There is an{Over 60's Club. of which there are{four people over 90 {in a population}of{350,}with nearly 100 people over 60 in the {Village. {There is one Butcher}who has a Travelling van and a{shop}in{The {Square}and a travelling{Greengrocer {and Fish Van}from{Grimsby.}There is a {Post Office }who also take {Horses at {Livery}and a{Postman }who carries newspapers to farms.{Services }are Gas on the Main Road,{Electricity, {Telephones}and{Dustbin Men }from Chesterfield.
